Residents also receive access to support services, including case management, job/housing search assistance, and transportation. Maximum length of stay is six months. Admittance requires referral from township trustee.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for information on obtaining a referral.
site_eligibility: Homeless women with or without children (age 17 or younger) -- With a referral from their township trustee (Only Portage County Residents)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering services that empower and support children and their families.
service_description: Provides home-based case management and advocacy to help families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families who do not have an open DCS or juvenile probation case -- Families who do not meet the criteria for participation in the Healthy Families program -- Families that have been referred by a community resource or self-referred due to a determination that family functioning can be improved and child abuse and neglect can be prevented

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization whose mission is provide housing for the homeless, help families keep their homes, and coach for sustainable lifestyles.
service_description: Provides transitional housing units to homeless persons living in Porter County. Residents are also offered support services, including case management, counseling, and employment and housing search assistance. Application required; wait list may apply. Maximum length of stay is 120 days.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information, or to apply for the wait list.
site_eligibility: Open -- Persons experiencing street homelessness

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need who live in Center and Washington Township of Porter County.
site_details: Walk in. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: drive through.
site_eligibility: Not used this pantry within the past 30 days

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF PORTER COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing education, advocacy and service through programs designed to promote health; positively affect public attitudes and perceptions of mental illness through support and knowledge.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF PORTER COUNTY
service_description: Provides a safe social outlet for adults living with mental illness who are treatment compliant. This drop-in center offers members opportunities to socialize, gain peer approval, enjoy outings, and build life skills to help maintain their path to wellness.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website to register.
site_eligibility: Treatment compliant adults with mental illness

agency_name: MIDWEST CENTER FOR YOUTH AND FAMILIES
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides a residential behavioral health treatment for youth in need.
site_name: MIDWEST CENTER FOR YOUTH AND FAMILIES
service_description: Provides residential mental health treatment for children and adolescents in need of intensive psychiatric treatment in a highly controlled and monitored setting. Services included dialectical therapy, medication management, interpersonal relationship building, academic achievement, peer groups, and socialization.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to speak with an intake specialist for assistance.
site_eligibility: Female: Age 10-18 years-old; Male: Age 12-18 years-old

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing transitional housing to men in recovery from chemical dependency.
service_description: Offers a halfway house for men recovering from illicit drug and alcohol addiction. Participants live and work on personal growth and are required to stay a minimum of 180 days (maximum 12 months). Residents pay a weekly rental fee and must be able to pay the first week's rent in advance.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment. -- Applications are also available online.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Men-- Must be committed to sobriety

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based organization that provides adoption services, foster parent recruitment and temporary care for children.
service_description: Provides short-term safety, support, and stabilized care for children when a family is experiencing a time of adversity.
taxonomy_name: Relinquishment for Adoption Assistance and Support
nameLevel4: Relinquishment for Adoption Assistance and Support
site_details: Visit the website to complete an application, or call to request one by sent by mail.
site_eligibility: Ages newborn-18

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides adult day programs, transportation, and vocational rehabilitation programs to persons in need in Northwest, Indiana.
service_description: Provides transportation services to doctorâ€™s appointments, therapy sessions, or other community locations in Porter County and parts of Lake and La Porte Counties. Riders who require assistance can have one personal assistant ride with them for free.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance to schedule a ride. -- If using Medicaid for payment, call Southeastrans.
site_eligibility: Porter County: Open -- Lake County: East of 53rd Street up to Lake Michigan; North of 109th St in Crown Pointe -- LaPorte County: West of 421

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry serving Portage Township of Porter County.
service_description: Provides food to households in need. Clients must first visit the Portage Township Trustee for a referral.
site_details: To obtain referral: Call the Portage Township Trustee office to request an appointment. Complete and submit an application for assistance. You can also download an application by visiting portagetrustee.org (assistance tab).
site_eligibility: With household income at or below 200% of Federal Poverty Level -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members -- Not received assistance from this pantry within the past month

agency_name: PORTER COUNTY AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering assistance to seniors, the disabled, and the low income.
site_name: PORTER COUNTY AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
service_description: Provides curb-to-curb transportation to persons in need in Porter County. Reduced-fee applications are available to seniors in need. All vehicles are wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call to schedule a ride, at least 48 hours in advance.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Porter County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Porter County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Porter County

agency_desc: A community mental health center offering a range of mental health and addiction treatment services.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons in need. Programs include individual and family counseling, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours. Psychiatric rehabilitation may be offered to eligible clients.

service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from a Porter Health System provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income. site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from Porter Health System (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (determined case by case)
